name: justiciable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be decided in a court of law: There are real questions as to whether matters of this kind are properly justiciable. There were no further justiciable issues for the court to adjudicate upon.
More examplesFewer examplesThose treaties supersede national law, and are justiciable before the European Court of Justice.The defendants argued that the claims for damages were not justiciable in our courts.29% of respondents reported one or more justiciable problems which they considered serious enough for action to be taken.
